name: [SECRET_VALUE]
description: The MeshDefaultkey=1 setting found in the wireless configuration files (RT2860AP.dat and RT2860AP5G.dat) may indicate the use of default wireless encryption keys.

name: telnet-default-enable
description: The telnet service is enabled by default, posing a potential risk of unauthorized access. It executes unconditionally and triggers during system startup.

name: wireless-config-copy
description: Wireless configuration file (SingleSKU) found copied to a writable directory, potentially exposing wireless configuration information. Executes unconditionally, triggered during system startup.
notes: Check whether the content of these .dat files contains sensitive wireless network configurations.

name: vsftpd-config-security
description:
Potential security configuration issues were identified in the FTP service configuration file. Although no hardcoded credentials were directly included, the following configuration items warrant attention:
1. anonymous_enable=NO - Disabling anonymous access is a security best practice
2. local_enable=YES - Allows local user logins
3. write_enable=YES - Enables write operations
4. chroot_local_user=YES - Restricts users to their home directories
5. max_clients=2 - Limits maximum connections
6. Passive mode port range configured (50000-60000)
7. Idle session timeout set (300 seconds)
code_snippet:
anonymous_enable=NO
local_enable=YES
write_enable=YES
chroot_local_user=YES
max_clients=2
pasv_min_port=50000
pasv_max_port=60000
idle_session_timeout=300
